item.title: FITS v8.3.0
item.description: • Fixed: Azure OAuth redirect URI: Fixed incorrect redirect URI detection that prevented Azure OAuth from working properly - now correctly detects IP or domain • Fixed: Azure OAuth refresh tokens: Fixed missing refresh tokens by adding required offline_access scope, allowing long-lived sessions • Fixed: Super admin user management: Fixed user edit redirects and user list display so super admins can properly manage users across tenants • Fixed: Duplicate email sending: Fixed issue where clicking test email sent two emails instead of one • Fixed: Transformers cache warning: Fixed deprecation warning that appeared during startup • Added: Test email functionality: Email provider detail pages now have "Send Test Email" button that sends actual test emails to tenant admin for verification • Added: Gmail email sending: Gmail provider now actually sends emails via Gmail API (previously returned success without sending) • Added: Exchange email sending: Exchange provider now sends emails via Exchange API (previously returned success without sending) • Added: Centralized user URLs: User navigation now uses role-based redirect logic for better user experience • Changed: Unified OAuth workflow: Removed separate "Connect" buttons - creating a provider now automatically initiates OAuth flow for simpler setup • Changed: Azure setup guide: Now dynamically displays the correct redirect URI based on current host, making setup easier • Changed: Email provider documentation: Updated to reflect the simplified OAuth workflow

item.title: FITS v8.2.2
item.description: • Added: User-selectable main project: Dashboard users can now choose which project to display as their main project for personalized views • Added: Improved dashboard performance: Dashboard now loads significantly faster with optimized data retrieval • Changed: Dashboard query optimization: Eliminated performance bottlenecks that caused slow dashboard loading times • Changed: Enhanced dashboard caching: Better data organization reduces redundant queries and improves response times

item.title: FITS v8.2.1
item.description: • Fixed: Scope publishing bug: Fixed critical issue where scopes with the same name in different projects could be published to the wrong project's Confluence space • Fixed: Scope page identification: Scope pages now include project name in title to ensure unique identification and prevent cross-project confusion

item.title: FITS v8.2.0
item.description: • Changed: Project unpublish validation: Unpublish button now properly checks for blocking relationships (assessments, templates) before allowing unpublish • Changed: Project detail view improvements: Better organization of project detail page components for improved usability • Fixed: Error logging consistency: Project operations now have consistent error logging for easier troubleshooting • Fixed: Project update error handling: Improved error messages and handling when project updates fail • Added: Project deletion safety checks: System now prevents deleting projects that have scopes with assessments or assessment templates, preventing data loss • Added: Enhanced project deletion: Two-step confirmation process for Confluence page deletion to prevent accidental data loss • Added: Confluence page management: System now checks if Confluence pages exist before deletion and provides better feedback • Added: Improved delete workflow: Better validation and user feedback throughout the project deletion process

item.title: FITS v8.1.2
item.description: • Fixed: Scope unpublish button: Fixed button remaining clickable when scope has assessments, which could cause data integrity issues • Fixed: Delete button feedback: Fixed delete button not showing why it's disabled, leaving users confused about why they can't delete • Changed: Unpublish button messaging: Button now clearly displays "Cannot unpublish (has assessments)" when disabled, explaining why action is unavailable • Changed: Delete button messaging: Button now shows descriptive message like "Cannot delete (has 2 assessments)" when disabled, providing clear feedback to users

item.title: FITS v8.1.1
item.description: • Fixed: Confluence status badges: Fixed badges showing raw markup text instead of clickable links, making them unusable • Fixed: Dark mode readability: Fixed unreadable badge text in Confluence dark mode that made status information invisible • Fixed: Table header visibility: Fixed missing text color in dark mode that made table headers invisible • Changed: Confluence status display: Replaced Confluence status macros with custom styled badges that work reliably in all themes • Changed: Badge theming: Improved badge styling to automatically adapt to both light and dark Confluence themes for better visibility • Changed: Environment links: Updated to use proper link elements that work correctly in all Confluence themes

item.title: FITS v8.1.0
item.description: • Fixed: JSON utilities error: Fixed syntax error that could cause application failures when processing JSON data • Changed: Docker standardization: Unified Docker base image across development and production environments for consistency and easier maintenance • Changed: Docker build performance: Improved build caching reduces build times and speeds up deployments • Changed: Deployment reliability: Enhanced error handling and improved deployment scripts reduce deployment failures

item.title: FITS v8.0.1
item.description: • Fixed: Report download fallback: Fixed reports not downloading when API response was missing URLs - system now uses fallback mechanism • Fixed: KPI dropdown behavior: Fixed dropdown staying open when clicking outside, which could cause multiple menus to remain visible • Changed: Report navigation: Improved handling of report downloads with better fallback support for backward compatibility • Changed: Code organization: Better separation of concerns improves maintainability and reduces bugs

item.title: FITS v8.0.0
item.description: • Fixed: Documentation accuracy: Fixed documentation inconsistencies that could mislead developers about AI implementation details • Fixed: AI provider capabilities: Fixed incorrect capability descriptions in UI that showed wrong information about provider features • Changed: AI provider configuration: Enhanced with integration mode support for better flexibility in provider setup • Changed: AI query optimization: Unified prompts and optimized queries across all AI tasks for better performance and consistency • Added: Composite AI providers: New pattern allows combining chat and embedding providers for optimal AI functionality • Added: Automatic embedding fallback: System automatically uses HuggingFace embeddings when providers don't have native embedding support • Added: HuggingFace integration: Added HuggingFace embedding provider as automatic fallback for providers without native embeddings

item.title: FITS v7.9.0
item.description: • Added: Changelog system: Implemented per-version changelog files for better organization and easier navigation • Added: Changelog list view: Users can browse all versions with proper semantic version sorting • Added: Changelog detail view: Each version has a dedicated page with markdown rendering for easy reading • Added: Navigation access: Added navbar link for quick access to changelog from anywhere in the application • Fixed: Release script security: Fixed shell variable injection vulnerability that could allow code execution • Fixed: Version sorting: Fixed incorrect version ordering in changelog list - now uses proper semantic versioning

item.title: FITS v7.8.5
item.description: • Fixed: Development server performance: Fixed CPU spike reaching 99% usage that made development environment unusable • Fixed: Auto-reload optimization: Constrained auto-reload to template directories only, preventing unnecessary restarts • Fixed: Uvicorn reload: Disabled uvicorn reload to prevent high CPU usage while maintaining browser auto-reload for HTML changes

item.title: FITS v7.8.4
item.description: • Fixed: Uvicorn reload error: Fixed NotImplementedError that prevented development server from reloading properly

item.title: FITS v7.8.3
item.description: • Added: Automated release management: Integrated changelog creation and versioning into release workflow for streamlined releases

item.title: FITS v7.8.2
item.description: • Security: Non-root container execution: All container services now run as non-root user, significantly reducing security attack surface • Security: Read-only filesystem: Production containers use read-only root filesystem with explicit writable paths, preventing unauthorized file modifications • Security: Capability reduction: Dropped unnecessary capabilities and added only required ones (NET_BIND_SERVICE) for minimal privilege principle • Security: Production hardening: Production containers default to non-root user execution for enhanced security • Changed: Service execution: All application services (Celery, Daphne, nginx) now run as non-root user by default • Changed: Container security: Improved security posture through comprehensive container hardening measures

item.title: FITS v7.11.7
item.description: • Fixed: Production deployment failures: Fixed multiple critical issues causing container crash loops that prevented successful deployments
